title: Juei Ushiromatsu
text:
is a Japanese former professional baseball relief pitcher who played in the <a href="New%20York%20Mets">New York Mets</a> minor league system in 1998. He is notable for being the first Japanese player to sign directly with a <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">major league</a> organization without playing any professional baseball in <a href="baseball%20in%20Japan">Japan</a>.
Background.
After attending Omagari Kogyo High School in <a href="Akita%20Prefecture">Akita Prefecture</a>, Ushiromatsu signed with New York in November 1997 at the urging of scout Isao Ojimi when he was 18 years old. The 6' 1", 165 pound left-handed pitcher, who was bypassed in Japan's amateur draft, signed for a bonus of about $100,000. He pitched for the <a href="Gulf%20Coast%20Mets">Gulf Coast Mets</a> that season - his only professional campaign in the United States - and went 0-2 with a 4.85 ERA in 16 relief appearances. His professional career ended prematurely after he injured his back in a car accident.
